intro: Lysipomia sphagnophila subsp. angelensis, commonly known as the Angel's moss, is a rare and specialized plant species native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Poaceae family and is characterized by its small, grass-like appearance with narrow, grassy leaves. This subspecies thrives in moist, acidic environments, often found in peat bogs and wetlands. Its botanical structure is adapted to withstand cold temperatures and high humidity, making it a unique component of its ecosystem. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
